questions.question_text: Which of the following are triggers for automatic creation of an issue? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Check your Business Rules: 
A: Create issue if test ineffective, closed
B: Create issue when result fails

AB is the correct answer - 
Issues are created with these conditions:
• Issue
o Created when an indicator fails
• Control Issue
o Created when a control attestation is completed indicating that the control is Not Implemented
• Control Test Issue
o Created when a control test is closed complete with the control effectiveness set to Ineffective

Selected Answer: AB
indicator failure create issue

choices.B: Indicator result is Failed or Not Passed
choices.D: Control tests have been assigned but not tested

questions.question_text: Risk criteria typically include definitions of different levels of what? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Different levels of impact and likelihood are defined by default. 
Priority is an outcome of impact and urgency, not associated to Risk Management.

Controls and Risks often maintain a many-to-many relationship with the Entity Type table in ServiceNow's GRC framework, whereas the relationship with Risk Statements and Policies might exist but is not usually established as a direct many-to-many connection with Entity Types.
